data.author: Simon Gene Gottlieb
data.message:
fix: save floats in explicit float notation (#67)

* fix: save floats in explicit float notation

YAML only has the concept of scalar values. So a value of '1' could be
an integer, float or string. ros2_persist_parameter_server relies
on being able to differentiate if something is a float or integer based
on the representation of numbers. Floating numbers must be written such
that they can not be mistaken as integers. This is comparable to how
many programming languages assume '1' is an integer and '1.0' is a
floating point number.

The library yaml-cpp exports a float without the distinguishing feature
required for ros2_persist_parameter_server. To fix this we manually
convert the double into a string representation and ensure that
a '.0' extension will be added when required.

Note to future maintainer. The current yaml-cpp branch has a
YAML::FpToString function which is better suited than using
std::stringstream but is not available in the current yaml-cpp release.

* fix: enforce a dot as decimal point

* refactor convertDoubleToString function.

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

* add test case to make sure double type can be handled.

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

* remove this problem from known issue description in README.md.

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

* skil auto-genrated CHANGELOG.rst from codespell checker.

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

* use std::abs instead of c abs().

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>
Co-authored-by: Tomoya Fujita <Tomoya.Fujita@sony.com>

data.author: Drew Hoener
data.message:
Added ros2 service call to manually trigger yaml save (#38)

* Add ROS2 Service to manually trigger save

Updates the parameter server's SaveYamlFile function to optionally check the content before saving, aborting if there is an error. The service call uses this to make sure the save was successful.

Signed-off-by: Andrew Hoener <ahoener@boston-engineering.com>

* Add ROS2 Service to trigger a reload from file

This is mostly used for testing, but could be useful if a user wants to discard parameter changes and reload.

Signed-off-by: Andrew Hoener <ahoener@boston-engineering.com>

* Add tests to make sure save & reload works properly

Signed-off-by: Andrew Hoener <ahoener@boston-engineering.com>

* Remove old/unused test.cpp as tests have been refactored

Signed-off-by: Andrew Hoener <ahoener@boston-engineering.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Andrew Hoener <ahoener@boston-engineering.com>

data.author: Mahmoud
data.message:
Fix/dynamic typing (#37)

* perform periodic storing of the yaml file.

This is useful to avoid data loss in case the node is killed by an
unexpected signal. By a SIGKILL for instance.

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

rename frequency to period and review formatting

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

implement reviewer comments

- throw if the given period is not strictly positive
- use unsigned int for the period
- don't make unecessary changes

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

don't perform periodic persistent parameter storing if the period is 0

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

* fix double parameter value cannot be set once loaded as an integer

When a parameter is loaded from yaml, its type cannot be changed latler
through a call to set_parameters serrvice. This is problematic for some
cases. The ParameterDescriptor's dynamic_typing is set to true to solve
this issue

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

* allow the user to control the dynamic typing option

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

* pass storing_period in options.parameter_overrides instead of class argument

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

* refactor the tests and add new test series for dynamic typing

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>

* correctly report test result summary code

---------

Signed-off-by: Mahmoud Almasri <mahm.al.masri@gmail.com>
